gametools

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • gametools.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GravityGame

    public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages game input, the game window and the output displayed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Initializes the game and runs the window method.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void centerPainterOn(Area obj)
      Centers the camera on a object by moving the painter location.
      Note: Only subsequent methods are affected, so the camera should only be moved at the start or end of the run method to prevent inconsistent results.

      • painter

        public static java.awt.Graphics2D painter()
        The 2D graphics object is referenced here. It can be used for drawing basic shapes, lines, images and text.
        Returns:
        The 2D graphics object that should be used for displaying all graphical output in the game.

      • mousePosition

        public static Position mousePosition()
        Returns the mouse position.
        Returns:
        The full mouse coordinates stored within a position.

      • setTitle

        protected void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title to display at the top of the game window. The default is no title.
        Parameters:
        title - The new title for the game window.

      • setBackground

        protected void setBackground(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the background to a solid color.
        Parameters:
        color - The color the background should be.

      • setBackground

        protected void setBackground(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Sets an image to a background. If the image is smaller than the screen size then it will be tiled automatically.
        Parameters:
        image - The image or tile to be used for the background.

      • setFPS

        protected void setFPS(int fps)
        Sets the rough amount of frames the game should display every second. The default is 60.
        Parameters:
        fps - The FPS the game should run at.

      • setWidth

        protected void setWidth(int width)
        Sets the width of the game.
        Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the game.

      • setHeight

        protected void setHeight(int height)
        Sets the height of the game.
        Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
        Parameters:
        height - The height of the game.

      • setDimensions

        protected void setDimensions(int width,
                             int height)
        Sets both the width and height of the game.
        Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the game.
        height - The height of the game.

      • setDimensions

        protected void setDimensions(java.awt.Dimension size)
        Sets both the width and height of the game.
        Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
        Parameters:
        size - The dimensions of the game.

      • hideCursor

        protected void hideCursor(boolean hide)
        Hides the cursor to allow a custom one, or displays it if it was hidden.
        Parameters:
        hide - True to hide the cursor, false to display it again.

      • translatePainter

        public static void translatePainter(double hor,
                                    double ver)
        Translates the camera position by moving the painter location.
        Note: Only subsequent methods are affected, so the camera should only be moved at the start or end of the run method to prevent inconsistent results.
        Parameters:
        hor - The amount to move the x by.
        ver - The amount to move the y by.

      • translatePainter

        public static void translatePainter(Position trans)
        Translates the camera position by moving the painter location.
        Note: Only subsequent methods are affected, so the camera should only be moved at the start or end of the run method to prevent inconsistent results.
        Parameters:
        trans - The amount to translate by.

      • centerPainterOn

        public static void centerPainterOn(double x,
                                   double y)
        Centers the camera on a position by moving the painter location.
        Note: Only subsequent methods are affected, so the camera should only be moved at the start or end of the run method to prevent inconsistent results.
        Parameters:
        x - The x location of the camera focus point.
        y - The y location of the camera focus point.

      • centerPainterOn

        public static void centerPainterOn(Area obj)
        Centers the camera on a object by moving the painter location.
        Note: Only subsequent methods are affected, so the camera should only be moved at the start or end of the run method to prevent inconsistent results.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to focus the camera on.

      • centerPainterOn

        public static void centerPainterOn(Position center)
        Centers the camera on a position by moving the painter location.
        Note: Only subsequent methods are affected, so the camera should only be moved at the start or end of the run method to prevent inconsistent results.
        Parameters:
        center - The new camera focal point.

      • mouseEngaged

        public static boolean mouseEngaged()
        Checks if any mouse button was just pressed down.
        Returns:
        True if any mouse button was just pressed.

      • mouseEngaged

        public static boolean mouseEngaged(int button)
        Checks if the specified mouse button was just pressed down.
        Parameters:
        button - An integer representing the mouse button pressed down (use the mouse event class to find the right integer).
        Returns:
        True if the specified mouse button was just pressed.

      • mouseReleased

        public static boolean mouseReleased()
        Checks if any mouse button was just released.
        Returns:
        True if any mouse button was just released.

      • mouseReleased

        public static boolean mouseReleased(int button)
        Checks if the specified mouse button was just released.
        Parameters:
        button - An integer representing the mouse button released (use the mouse event class to find the right integer).
        Returns:
        True if the specified mouse button was just released.

      • mousePressed

        public static boolean mousePressed()
        Returns whether or not anything on the mouse is pressed.
        Returns:
        True if any button on the mouse is currently pressed.

      • mousePressed

        public static boolean mousePressed(int button)
        Used to determine whether a button on the mouse is currently pressed by the user.
        Parameters:
        button - An integer representing the mouse button being searched for (use the mouse event class to find the right integer).
        Returns:
        True if one of the mouse buttons being pressed down matches the input.

      • mouseWithin

        public static boolean mouseWithin(Area obj)
        Checks if the mouse is currently inside an object.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to check collision with the mouse.
        Returns:
        True if the mouse is completely inside the specified object.

      • mouseWithin

        public static boolean mouseWithin(java.util.List<Sprite> sprites)
        Checks if the mouse is inside any of the elements in the group.
        Parameters:
        sprites - The array list to check collision with.
        Returns:
        True if the mouse is within at least one element in the group.

      • mouseWithin

        public static boolean mouseWithin(Group sprites)
        Checks if the mouse is inside any of the elements in the group.
        Parameters:
        sprites - The group to check collision with.
        Returns:
        True if the mouse is within at least one element in the group.

        public static boolean keyEngaged()
        Checks if any button on the keyboard was just pressed down.

        True if any button on the keyboard was just pressed.

      • keyEngaged

        public static boolean keyEngaged(int key)
        Checks if the specified key was just pressed down.

        Returns:
        True if the specified key was just pressed.

        public static boolean keyReleased()

      • keyReleased

        public static boolean keyReleased(int key)
        Checks if the specified key was just released.
        Parameters:
        key - An integer representing the key released (use the key event class to find the right integer).
        Returns:
        True if the specified key was just released.

      • keyPressed

        public static boolean keyPressed()
        Returns whether or not anything on the keyboard is pressed.
        Returns:
        True if any button on the keyboard is currently pressed.

      • keyPressed

        public static boolean keyPressed(int key)
        Used to determine whether a key is currently pressed by the user.
        Parameters:
        key - An integer representing the key being searched for (use the key event class to find the right integer).
        Returns:
        True if one of the keys being pressed down matches the input.

      • create

        protected void create()
        Initializes the game and creates the window. Calls the setup method after creating the window and then loops the run method at the specified FPS.
        Note: This function should only be executed in the main method and only once.

      • window

        protected abstract void window()
        Method for creating window and adjusting game settings.

      • setup

        protected abstract void setup()
        Method that runs only once for initializing objects and running setup code.

      • run

        protected abstract void run()
        Method that updates at the specified FPS (the default is 60) that should contain most the main game code.
